changes_c.title: First update
changes_c.description: The beginnning! created the project and started slapping bits together.
changes_c.impact: Creating the framework to make the adventure work.

changes_m.title: First commit
changes_m.description: Createds the POC for the project, minimal assets and starting to get the look and feel I need
changes_m.impact: This allows me to finally start working on the menus and controls etc.

changes_s.title: Added Sounds
changes_s.description: Recorded my actual keyboard and added rudimentary way to play sounds
changes_s.impact: BOSS speaking to you will now be in the sound of my keys.

changes_s.title: Added Controls
changes_s.description: Made a basic injector for controls

changes_s.title: Backbone html and css added
changes_s.description: Just making the environment less blocky and dull
changes_s.impact: The frame that i am going to put everything else into.

changes_c.title: Small file commit
changes_c.description: Added the README.md so GitHub would leave me alone.

changes_m.title: Added SONGS!
changes_m.description: This is for a future update where i want to add a Theme Hospital style 'radio' to the game.
changes_m.impact: This will force the volume controls i started building in the original framework.

changes_m.title: Large update to Screen
changes_m.description: Massive changes to how the screen is populated and the multiple diffeerent ways of giving the player information.
changes_m.impact: This is essentially like a debug out for the GM currently, but will become the home of dialogues etc too.

changes_s.title: Async chats
changes_s.description: I started fiddling with making things wait for other things to complete.

changes_c.title: Refactor
changes_c.description: Sound was refactored to its own lieelt spot and so that it can live in peace.

changes_m.title: Refactor
changes_m.description: Major refactoring of sound and music area.
changes_m.impact: Enables easy invocation of objects. Sounds and music also preload and stay loaded, less chop, more clicky clacky typing!

changes_s.title: ShitTalk
changes_s.description: I didn't know at this point, but BOSS started to get a personality.

changes_m.title: B.O.S.S.
changes_m.description: Introducing your GM, narrator, and all round sassy side-kick: B.O.S.S!

changes_m.title: B.O.S.S. Things
changes_m.description: BOSS will now guide you through the start of your adventure and will be quite upset if you offend him.
changes_m.impact: This gave me the idea for a hidden mechanic for your side-kick in the game. He is, after all, your link to the world you interact with.

changes_s.title: ShitTalk continued
changes_s.description: Now that BOSS suddenly became a large mechanic in the game I needed a spot for quirky quotes. And I didn't want them to be static. And I needed something to fill the changelog with.
changes_s.impact: Framework for reading and parsing JSON

changes_s.title: JSON unleashed
changes_s.description: I need a place for text and object assets. Sue me. I added a reliable way to read my JSON assets and then parse them into an object nice and neat.

changes_c.title: Bug
changes_c.description: Fixed my bad code for creating controls, they can now be nice an colorful, just like YOU

changes_s.title: Style
changes_s.description: Mostly got rid of bad styles and neatened stuff up.

changes_c.title: Font
changes_c.description: We are now using the exact font (maybe improved a little) that was used in DOS!

changes_c.title: Control
changes_c.description: While BOSS is talking, i don't want the player to be able to interfere... mostly... so i created a proper way to disable controls.

changes_m.title: Large update
changes_m.description: Added a Changelog (the thing you are reading now), Icons, an element builder to make life easier and with less static HTML as string in my code.
changes_m.impact: Check the areas below for more info.

changes_m.title: Hosted!
changes_m.description: canabalized my site for my twitch bot to host this instead.

changes_s.title: Changelog
changes_s.description: The JSON reader and a good way to use the data as objects in my code made this process much better, now there is a nice place to put all this for those who feel like reading.

changes_s.title: Screen Refactor
changes_s.description: Removed the old screen script and replaced it with a newer, more convoluted, screen script that has a proper structure for adding lines, checking screen fits, and waiting for messages to finish before making a disco of letters.
changes_s.impact: Dialoges can now be a thing!

changes_s.title: String extensions
changes_s.description: I miss C# okay... HOW CAN THERE NOT BE AN EXTENTION FOR String.prototype.equalsIgnoreCase???
changes_s.impact: Better checks makes it less likely that the iffy js checks fail me and accidentally nukes Japan again.

changes_c.title: Scrollbar
changes_c.description: I have a scrollbar now... it is styled... I hate the default scrollbar.

changes_c.title: Ctrl + K + F
changes_c.description: Went through everything and fixed formatting.

changes_m.title: First Encounters
changes_m.description: BIG update! you can now have an encounter! with a Barman! i know i know, not really that badass but go check the GitHub page if you really want to see how much this change required.
changes_m.impact: plugging in encounters, scenes and dialogs etc will now populate properly. people can have dialogs. NPCs are starting to take form. Basically the main gameplay loop engine, and it's ALL MINE!

changes_s.title: Flow
changes_s.description: Added the ability to "Wake" instead of power on which will skip a bunch of setting creation. This will become something that is unlockable once you have a save slot created.
changes_s.impact: Faster start times, still loading assets, so still takes time, but not that much anymore.

changes_s.title: Control
changes_s.description: made it easier to add controls and handlers. this was the core of being able to navigate scenes.
changes_s.impact: opens up the posibilities to create other interactables in the same way like pocket items etc in future.

changes_c.title: Styling
changes_c.description: A bit of a spit-shine on some of the ui stuff, added socials, spaced stuff a bit more etc.
changes_c.impact: Click a social... i dare you
